comments: brilliant, an expert in Asian studies and head of her department, but this keeps her from returning your work for weeks with no feedback. You won\'t receive any work back for at least 3 months into the semester. She also takes multiple absences and cuts out major pieces of history as a result. Don\'t buy the book, you wont use it once. No one passes

comments: Very sweet and caring, but extremely test heavy. Essay portions of the test are extremely hard to get a good grade on (even if you write 6 pages), especially if you leave out one little detail that\'s important. I\'m usually a straight A student, but got a C on a test (even though I studied super hard)... ouch.

comments: Caring teacher who wants you to succeed but you just have to put in the work. The semester is made up of 3 test/1 book review so it is important you study and come to class. She grades in a timely manner and has interesting lectures. Plus if you\'re interested in history she offers many interesting side notes on places to travel or books to read.

comments: Pennington is a nice lady, and I thought her lectures were enjoyable. However, I had a hard time in this course. She grades on 3 tests and 1 paper in the whole course, which isn\'t a big issue by itself, but she literally took months to hand back grades, so for a lot of the class you don\'t know your grade. Because of that, I wouldn\'t take her again.

comments: Great professor. Energetic and caring. Many COC students are pathetic because of years helicopter parenting. Pennington is clear, grades fairly, and has reasonable expectations. She makes you work, but the demands are reasonable. The complaints posted here say more about those complaining than her and her teaching. She is genuinely nice and fair.

comments: If you don\'t attend class, you will not pass. The whole class is based on her lecture, only take her if you absolutely have to. Best suggestion is to take your laptop and type everything she says. You must remember all dates and the chronological order of events in detail for all the exams. Using the textbook will not help you in this class.
